channel.title: the first template :: Web Apps in Lisp: Know-how
channel.description: Our route only returns a string: (easy-routes:defroute root ("/") () "hello app") Can we have it return a template? Weâ€™ll use Djula HTML templates. Usually, templates go into their templates/ directory. But, we will start out by defining our first template inside our .lisp file: ;; scr/myproject.lisp (defparameter *template-root* " <title> Lisp web app </title> <body> hello app </body> ") Compile this variable as you go, with C-c C-c (or call again load from any REPL).
